greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n^2 - 1 divided by its largest square divisor.
comment: In other words, squarefree part of n^2-1.
Least m for which x^2 - m*y^2 = 1 has a solution with x = n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
example: 7^2-1 = 48, whose largest square divisor is 16, so a(7) = 48/16=3.
program: f y (p:ps'@(p':ps)) | p == p' = f y ps
results.author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, Feb 25 2002
ext: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 27 2007
